body_html:
@aosokin can you show the warning you get, as well as any warning flags you enabled (e.g. torch.utils.backcompat.broadcast_warning=True)?

To answer your later question, this behavior changed with the introduction of broadcasting; "A" and "mask" are being broadcasted to shape (5,5,5) and since the mask is all ones you get an output tensor of size 555.
body_text:
@aosokin can you show the warning you get, as well as any warning flags you enabled (e.g. torch.utils.backcompat.broadcast_warning=True)?
To answer your later question, this behavior changed with the introduction of broadcasting; "A" and "mask" are being broadcasted to shape (5,5,5) and since the mask is all ones you get an output tensor of size 555.
body:
@aosokin can you show the warning you get, as well as any warning flags you enabled (e.g. torch.utils.backcompat.broadcast_warning=True)?

To answer your later question, this behavior changed with the introduction of broadcasting; "A" and "mask" are being broadcasted to shape (5,5,5) and since the mask is all ones you get an output tensor of size 5*5*5.
